Solicitation Title: FDIC's Board Room Collective Technology Refresh
Description Text:
The FDIC is seeking a design-build contractor to transform the FDIC’s Board Room Collective (BRC), located at FDIC headquarters at 550 17th Street, Washington DC, into a state-of-the-art broadcasting and collaboration spaces (referred to herein as “the solution”) with high quality audio, video, lighting, and associated construction. The solution will be highly available, effective, and efficient while ensuring audio and video (AV) worthiness wherein all in-person and remote Board Members, participants, and observers in an audio, video, or combined audio and video call can hear (and be heard) and see (and be seen) clearly. AV worthiness means attendees and audiences at any location in the room or remotely will be able to hear (and be heard) and see (and be seen) clearly. The Division of Information Technology (DIT) and the Division of Administration (DOA) are collaborating on the approach to technology and room modernization requirements.

This posting is for the Request for Proposal. See attachments for the full RFP and due dates. Please read the solicitation in it's entirety including SOO and Attachments to the SOO.  Please note this requirement involves a two-step selection process, Please send an email to the CO expressing interest to attend the Site Visit (limited to 2 per company) no later than January 10, 2025. You must include the signed Confidentiality Agreements prior to attending the Site Visit and to be sent via email Attachments1,2,3 to the SOO.  The Site Visit will take place on January 17,2025  at 10am EST and all attendees must be in-person.

All Questions and Phase I - Volume I Proposals are due by 12PM EST. January 31, 2025. FDIC will respond to all questions with an amendment posted to SAM.gov after the question due date.

 Vendors will be notified if they may continue to Phase II based on the rating of their Phase I-Volume I Proposals. 

Phase II Proposals are due by 12PM EST March 25, 2025.

1/10/2025 - Amendment 0001 is hereby issued to add a Phase I Questions due date of January 21, 2025 at 12PM est. See attachments.

1/24/2025 - Amendment 0002 is hereby issued to issue the Government's response to Questions recieved regarding Phase I Proposals and Evaluation. All Phase I Proposals are due on January 31, 2025 by Noon EST. 

1/25/2025 - Amendment 0003 is hereby issued to add responses and questions to Phase I Q&A (reflected in red) and post the Site Visit Presentation from 1/17/2025. Please note Site Visit Questions and Responses will be posted in a seperate amendment.  All Phase I Proposals are due on January 31, 2025 by Noon EST.

1/29/2025 - Added Attendee's list from Site Visit held on 1/17/2025 at FDIC. Amendment 0004 is issued to extend the Phase I Propoasl due date to February 14, 2025 by Noon EST. All Phase II Questions are still due on January 31, 2025 by Noon EST. See Attachments. 

2/15/2025 - Amendment 0005  is issued to provide the Government's responses to the Site Visit and Phase II Questions. As a result, some edits have been made to the solicitation.  A revised SOO and SOO Attachments B & D  and Attachment L-1 Page Limitations have been provided in Amendment 0005. Confidential SOO Attachment 2 has been edited and SOO Attachments 4-7 have been added to the SOO. These Attachments will be provided to vendors who have submitted Confidentiality Agreements and Phase I Proposals. No further questions will be answered. 

The FDIC anticipates sending notifications to Offerors regarding Phase I by February 26, 2025. Phase II Proposals are due March 25, 2025 at Noon EST.

3/7/2025 - Amendment 0006 is hereby issued to add,edit, and delete contract clauses/provisions and extend the Phase II Proposal due date to April 4, 2025 at Noon EST. See Attachments.

Solicitation Title: Near Earth Orbit Network Program's Sounder for Microwave-Based Applications
Description Text:
NASA Goddard Space Flight Center plans to issue a Draft Request for Proposal (RFP) for the Near Earth Orbit Network (NEON) Program’s Sounder for Microwave-Based Applications (SMBA) Instrument.

SMBA will be a microwave sounding instrument flying on the NEON program series of low-earth orbit satellites. SMBA will have hyperspectral sounding capabilities to support the acquisition of high-resolution atmospheric temperature and moisture profiles used in a variety of applied products for weather forecasting and atmospheric monitoring. The procurement will consist of 12 SMBA flight models, one instrument Engineering Test Unit, and associated Ground Support Equipment (GSE) and simulators. The contract scope includes the requirements necessary to design, analyze, develop, fabricate, integrate, test, evaluate, and support launch of SMBA instruments; supply and maintain the instrument GSE; and support the Mission Operations at the mission operations facility. The SMBA instrument has a risk classification of Class C.

The Government does not intend to acquire a commercial product or commercial service using FAR Part 12.   

This acquisition is a Full and Open competition. 

The NAICS Code and Size Standard are 334511 and 1,350 employees, respectively.

The anticipated release date of the Draft RFP is the end of the first quarter of 2025 and the anticipated release date of the Final RFP is the end of the second quarter of 2025 with an anticipated offer due approximately 30 calendar days later.

The Draft RFP will be posted for information and planning purposes. No proposal is requested and no contract will be awarded as a result of the Draft RFP. Potential Offerors are invited to comment on all aspects of the solicitation including the requirements, proposal instructions, and evaluation approach. If your comments include recommendations for revisions, you must provide your rationale for such revisions. The timeline for comments to the Draft RFP will be specified in the Draft RFP Cover Letter.

NASA Clause 1852.215-84, Ombudsman, is applicable. The Center Ombudsman for this acquisition can be found at : https://www.hq.nasa.gov/office/procurement/regs/Procurement-Ombuds-Comp-Advocate-Listing.pdf

It is the offeror's responsibility to monitor this website for the release of the Draft RFP, RFP and amendments (if any). Potential offerors will be responsible for downloading their own copy of the Draft RFP, RFP, and amendments (if any). 

Prospective offerors are encouraged to notify this office of their intent to submit an offer.

All contractual and technical questions must be submitted electronically via email to Bruce.B.Tsai@nasa.gov.  Telephone questions will not be accepted.

Revision 1 (2025/03/07): 

For planning purposes only, the Government will update the notional timeline as follows:


	Draft RFP Release: Calendar Year (CY) 2025, Quarter (Q) 2
	RFP Release: CY 2025, Q4
	Award: CY 2026, Q4

Solicitation Title: TSE Staffing Services
Description Text:
The Office of Technical Security Engineering (TSE) plays an essential role in advancing U.S. security by providing specialized network security, cybersecurity, technical surveillance countermeasures, construction security, and technical security training to DS professionals to protect U.S. personnel, facilities, and sensitive information against acts of crime, terrorism, and technical espionage.

The Training Directorate (DS/T) is responsible for the administration of the Bureau of Diplomatic Security's training mission. DS/T focuses on increasing efficiency & driving innovation using enhanced technology & expanded learning practices to provide greater training opportunities to our global security workforce.

The Office of Mobile Security Deployments (DS/T/MSD) is the Department’s on-call tactical operations, crisis preparedness, and contingency operations element.

Current operations are conducted at multiple sites within the National Capital Region (NCR). These cities include, but are not limited to, Dunn Loring, VA, Springfield, VA, Quantico, VA, Fort Washington, MD, and Washington, D.C.

DS/T/TSE, DS/T, and DS/T/MSD has a need for certified, experience Contractor support to enhance training and operational services. The Contractor shall provide anticipated services including, but not limiting to, the following activities:


	Management and administration services include staffing, regular reporting on task orders, coordinating contractual actions, cost/finance management, QC/QA initiatives, and risk management programs.
	Subject Matter Expertise services include fulfilling mission objectives, evaluating operations, training, threat mitigation, counterintelligence/counterterrorism assessments, threat research, and providing consultation and routine training.
	Administrative Support Services include procurement support, fleet management, courier services, property disposition, equipment and supply orders, facility maintenance, travel and lodging logistics, and administrative, executive, office management, and clerical support.
	Program Support services include expertise in technology planning and maintenance, logistical coordination, training curriculum development, instructional design, data management, technical writing, research, visual information support, employee training programs, and the development and deployment of distance learning and interactive courseware.
